column3: str
Alphinaud is determined to offer the villagers what succor he can.
Speak with Matsya.
Speak with Matsya again.
Search for Qerasaf.
Aid the wounded Qerasaf.
Survey the area.
Continue to survey the area.
Continue to survey the area.
Speak with Matsya.
His wounds are deep, but he may yet be saved. I will see to him─pray look after the others!
When I last came here to sell my fish, everyone was so bright and cheerful. This is a nightmare...
The horror... I pray that the Sisters will see us through this calamity...
There is nothing you can do for this villager.
This villager has been dead for some time.
I...I am fine, thank you... Please...save the others...
This poor soul is beyond saving.
I can tend to the rest. Pray look after Matsya─no doubt what we have seen here weighs even heavier on his heart than ours.
Stay by Matsya's side, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. Unlike us, he is not accustomed to seeing such horrors...
Oh, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>!
This is Yeruvvet, the elder here. He is hurt, but─praise be to the Sisters─he still lives!
Young Matsya here has told me everything. I have not the words to express my gratitude for your aid.
When the heavens began to burn, we were afraid, but did our best to carry on as we always have done...
Until today, when those unholy beasts came pouring into our village, a flood of midnight and death...

There are no words to describe what followed. Men and women I have known since they were babes struck down by the creatures, only to rise again to join the murderous horde, in the guise of those same hideous fiends...
In the chaos, a handful of our villagers fled for their lives. I can only hope they have found their way to safety...
Matsya, do you perchance remember Qerasaf and Mehvan? The young couple who always bought your freshest catches...
How could I forget, Elder? When I first came to peddle my wares─desperate to eke out a living─they showed me such kindness...
Others shunned me as an outsider, as is their way. But Qerasaf and Mehvan bought my fish, and sung its praises. They turned my fortunes around!
Alas, I fear they are in terrible danger. I saw them running towards Agama Temple, one of those beasts in close pursuit.
They had their child─still but a tiny babe. To elude these fiends while caring for one so young is an impossible task, surely. I beg of you, go to their aid...
I...I want to help them. Yet I am but a fisherman─I cannot face beasts on my own. Will you come with me?
Oh, thank you! Agama Temple lies to the west of here. We must hurry!
Don't worry─Alphinaud and I will watch over the village until you return. Go and find Matsya's friends.
The temple is just ahead...
It was built by those who worship Saint Agama, but has sadly fallen into disrepair in recent years.
If my friends made it this far, no doubt they are hiding somewhere amidst the ruins.
(-???-)No, please! Stay ba─annngggh...gggaaah!
That was Qerasaf! Oh, no─this is not good!
What will you say?
I'll take a look.
Wait here.
P-Please do! The cry came from the ruins. You must hurry!
Y-Yes, I understand... The cry came from the ruins! You must hurry!
That was Qerasaf's voice─I'm sure of it! Oh gods...gods have mercy...
Aieeeeeeeeeghhh!
Why...why...aaaaaaghhh...
The man lies motionless on the ground, bearing a grievous wound...
I'm sorry, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. I tried to stay behind, but I couldn't...
No...it cannot be!
Is someone... Anyone...
My arms...so heavy... And my legs... I cannot feel my legs...
My wife...fled with our daughter...
I need to find them...need to be with them...
I need...
Qerasaf! No, Qerasaf─you must stay strong!
More time... I thought I had...
I...I don't want to die...
What will you do?
Speak to Qerasaf.
Dry Qerasaf's tears.
Thank you...
Please...find them...
Mehvan still lives. And she has their child...
We must search the jungle between here and Palaka's Stand. There is nowhere else she could have gone. I think...
Forgive me, Qerasaf... Once we have saved your wife and child, we will return and lay you to rest...
You see no tracks or other signs of recent travel. Mehvan and the child must be elsewhere...
Aaaaaaaaaaaaghhh!
Urk... Urggggggggghhh...
If Mehvan and her daughter came through this area recently, you see no evidence of their passage...
...There. Your wounds have closed. Can you stand?
Just a moment, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. I'll be with you shortly.
D-Did you see any sign of them? I found nothing!
Perhaps the beasts have chased them farther from the village.
Oh, gods above, I beseech you! Pray deliver Mehvan and her little one to safety...
